intro: Spermacoce ericifolia, commonly known as the hairy bedstraw, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to regions of Africa, including South Africa, and thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, small white or pale pink flowers, and hairy leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Spermacoce ericifolia is often found in dry environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
